article.headline: Portland St. 102, Lamar 98
article.story: DALLAS -- Chris Harriel scored 23 points and Chehales Tapscott had a double-double as Portland State held off Lamar 102-98 Saturday at the SMU Invitational. Tapscott picked up 19 points and 13 rebounds for the Vikings (2-1). Melvin Jones added 18 points, Charles Odum 13 and Nate Lozeau 12. Lamar's Kendrick Harris took game honors with 25 points. Charlie Harper added 19 for the Cardinals (2-1), Vincenzo Nelson 13 and Anthony Miles 11. Portland State held a shooting advantage of 54.8 percent (34 of 62) to 46.8 percent (36 of 77). Both teams made six 3-pointers, but Portland State missed just six while Lamar missed 17. Nelson scored with 1:23 left to pull Lamar within 96-95, but the Vikings sank four free throws to go up 100-95. Harris drilled a 3-pointer for the Cardinals to make it 100-98 with seven seconds left before Jones made two free throws to ice it.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
